text: Anarsia procera is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Kyu- Tek Park and Margarita Gennadievna Ponomarenko in 1996. It is found in Thailand. The wingspan is about 16 mm. The forewings are creamy white, suffused with brown scales and a small, dark brown costal mark, as well as two triangular streaks on the costal margin from the base to the costal mark. There is a small dark brown streak near the base. The hindwings are grey. ==References== procera Category:Moths described in 1996 Category:Moths of Asia
title: Anarsia procera
